oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Kirkpatrick Elementary School, Nashville, Tennessee, n.d.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An exterior view of Kirkpatrick Elementary School, located at 1000 Sevier Street, in Nashville, Tennessee. Kirkpatrick Elementary School opened in December 1952, named for C. T. Kirkpatrick who graduated from Fogg High School and Vanderbilt University, taught Latin at Fogg High School, and served as principal of Hume-Fogg High School from 1914 until his retirement in 1940. Kirkpatrick School offered grades 1-6 until 1971. At that time the school was paired with Warner School, appropriately interchanging students to make Warner grades 1-4 and Kirkpatrick grades 5-6 with special education and kindergarten. Forms part of the Metro Archives Photographs - School Collection. 1 photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Kirkpatrick Elementary School (Nashville, Tenn.)
